channel.title: Broken axoloti?
channel.description:
Hey ,
I have bought three axoloti's in the past ...now one is suddely not working anymore can't do firmware rescue anymore and the sd card is getting hot while trying ...seems totally dead ! any advice would be welcome ...
Thanx in advance
Reinhard

item.title: Broken axoloti?
item.dc:creator: @reinhard Reinhard
item.description:
@reinhard wrote:

Thanx for you reply , but the axoloti is totally dead and don't wanna buy another replacement
i got one euxoloti still running gonna take my time ...really shitty could be bad contact with hardware
was long time ago i build this first prototype and this isn't what makes me happy right now ...
thanx again for your respons Greetz Reinhard

Read full topic

item.title: Broken axoloti?
item.dc:creator: @urklang Nicolas Steven Miller
item.description:
@urklang wrote:

Just power it normally and check all of the power rails with a multimeter, i.e. check that you can see the +5V rail and that the 3.3V VDD/VDDA/VDDC look correct. Try using only bus power coming from USB rather than the barrel jack if that's what you've been using.

If there's not an obvious electrical problem there, put it into DFU mode like you would for rescue and make sure that it's showing up as a DFU device with your operating system. On Linux that can be done with lsusb for example.

If that all checks out then go back to trying rescue mode in the patcher, does the app actually report that it connects to the device and then start trying to flash?

Read full topic
